means: （使）某物侧边提高，倾斜，翻倒( tip的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He tipped the table over in front of him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把面前的桌子打翻了。

sentence.Network_en: She tipped the barmen 10 dollars and bought drinks all round.
sentence.Network_cn: 她给了吧台服务员10美元小费，还请在场的所有人喝了酒。

sentence.Network_en: He tipped his head to one side and sighed dramatically.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把头歪向一边，重重地叹了口气。

entry.tran: (与名词连用构成形容词)表示“有…顶端的”，“覆盖着…的”
entry.def: -tipped combines with nouns to form adjectives that describe something as having a tip made of a particular substance or covered with a particular material.

example.ex: In his hand, he carried a gold-tipped crook.
example.tran: 他手里拿着一根有金制曲柄的手杖。

means.word_mean: 1. having a tip; or having a tip as specified (used in combination);
2. departing or being caused to depart from the true vertical or horizontal;

auth_sentence.content: I met Col. Morton...and tipped my hat in greeting.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I met Col. Morton...and tipped my hat in greeting.
